And after that Linkedin might ask me to review my details, and sometimes it will prompt me to upload additional resume or answers specific questions. and after reviewing the application, I can just tap, submit to send the application.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Oh, wow! That's pretty comprehensive. I was wondering what is the most common feature that you believe helps you in your application process.

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder
transcript.text: Okay. So the feature that I use most frequently, I would say, is checking the news feed, because when I open Linkedin it loads directly into the home tab. and from the home tab I can see like a scrollable list of posts, and the posts are usually from the updates of my connections. Companies that I follow or Linkedin suggested Post, or like the post, from the groups that I joined, and as I scroll I can see options under each post. I can either like comment or share the post, and if something interests me like a shared article on the latest technology, I can tap like, or sometimes I'll leave a comment. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder
transcript.text: Okay, so for the people you mean, do you mean, like the groups that I join? Or how do I connect with people.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder
transcript.text: Oh, okay, cool. So when I want to connect with someone that I already know who they are, then I'll just tap on the search bar which is located at the top center of the screen. And when I type the person's name, then Linkedin will just shows relevant profiles as I type. and once I see the person I'm looking for, I just tap on their profile and on their profile page there's a blue connect button beneath their name. and when I tap connect Linkedin will give me the option to add a note, and I can add a personal message saying something like, Hi. I came across your profile, and I would love to connect with you, and after writing the message I can press, send to send the connection request with my note. And as for how do I connect with the people in the like? How do I find the groups that I interested in? I can go to the my network tab and scroll down to the groups. You may be interested in section. and there's an there's a button to see all new groups. So after clicking the see, all Button Linkedin will display the suggested groups like their recommendation, that, based on my profile and connections. And so. after viewing the all the groups that are recommended. I can click on the join button. If I find a group that looks active and relevant. and once I'm a member I can see the post from the group. And also I can like connect with people within the same group. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Oh, wow! That is very exciting. Well, you've mentioned several times about job recommendations and Linkedin sending you relevant information job post. So just wanted to understand how you even get those recommendations like. is there a setting for that? Or how do you go about getting those recommendations.

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder
transcript.text: Okay? So I believe the recommendations are based on the saved filters for the jobs and to get those notifications. You can like the steps is basically the same when you're looking for jobs. Just that after setting your filters for the jobs that you're looking for. Then Linkedin will send you notification. With the list of the recommended job postings. You can either receive the notification through the app or through email like, based on your setting. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

You can select preferences. and then there's a job alert button, and after that you can manage the frequency for each like save job filters. you can click on the pencil icon on the right of each filter, and you can set like, whether you want to receive the recommendation on a daily basis, or like once a week. and also set the notification type. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder

And after that you can see, like, different categories of jobs. And there's a save jobs. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

To your personal profile you can add the add section button where you can like edit the about section or education section or position section and etc. So let's say, we click on the about section. And after that you can just add the edit, the about section, and after that you click on the save button. Then you're up. The updates that you, the changes that you make will be updated. And also, you can upload your resume to Linkedin. Yeah? And also, like you can update your status like indicating you're open to work and to do. So, you just click on the open to button on your profile page. And you can select, like. like, you're finding a new job and set your preferences. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Wow! No, I believe that's very detailed. However, I would want to understand. In the entire journey. Were there any obstacles that you faced while using Linkedin.

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder
transcript.text: a 1 obstacle that I face is with Job filtering. because Linkedin's filters are somewhat limited, and I often wish there was a way to filter the jobs by specific skills or technologies rather than just job titles or locations. Because sometimes I want to look for jobs that mention specific software or programming languages. But Linkedin doesn't provide these granular options. and another challenge is connecting with certain people who have strict privacy settings. For example, I'll send an connection request with the personalized message. But sometimes I don't get a response, or my request is ignored because Linkedin limits the direct connections with people outside the network.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer

transcript.speaker: Stakeholder

Actions:

Goals:
* Professional Communication - Primarily, Jacqueline’s email use is for career needs - receiving updates from recruiters, scheduling, and networking. Given this, reliable access to important emails from recruiters is critical.
* Staying Updated on Academic Announcements - Another goal is to use email to stay current with university communications, from notifications to updates from platforms like Canvas.
* Personal Organization – Other than goals related to school and career, Jacqueline uses email for organizing personal appointments (e.g., medical appointments) and to keep track of offers or discounts from merchants.
* Organizing Inbox - She prefers a clutter-free inbox, frequently categorizing, deleting, or tagging emails to streamline her interactions and ensure that critical emails are easy to access.
* Efficient Email Composition - Jacqueline values efficiency when composing emails and often relies on an AI assistant to make the process faster and more precise.

Actions:
* Checking Emails Frequently for Recruiter Messages - Logs in multiple times (more than 5 times) daily to ensure important updates are not missed.
* Inbox Scanning and Cleanup - Jacqueline typically scans her inbox, marking emails that need action and deleting irrelevant or spam emails.
* Tagging and Flagging - She tags or flags important emails that require future attention or follow-up.
* Deleting Non-Essential Emails - Deletes email threads once they’re no longer relevant to keep the inbox clean.
* Using Separate Accounts - Jacqueline keeps her professional, academic, and personal emails separate, which helps  in managing different types of communication effectively.
* Using AI for Email Composition - Starts by listing her main points, then uses an AI assistant to generate the full message, which she then tweaks and formats as needed (e.g., bolding key points).
* Multimedia Management - She prefers uploading files to the cloud and sharing links instead of direct attachments to make sharing easier.
* Notifications for Priority Emails - Jacqueline values notifications but does not completely rely on them because of the potential for missing important emails.
* Summarization – She performs manual summarization now. But also for future: desires a feature to summarize emails and highlight main points to save time on review.
* Managing Categorization – She categorizes communication and finds categorization useful but also frustrating when important emails land in spam.
* Monitoring Tasks and Deadlines - Uses flagged emails to manage time-sensitive actions.

Goals:
* Pain point of the lack of seamless interaction flow within the app. As such, in her opinion, there's a need to streamline and improve the overall user experience of various social media platforms. More specifically, a centralized social media platform. E.g. "The main goal is to have an interface that feels intuitive right from the first use. Right now, some areas feel like users are guessing instead of navigating."
* Clarification on features: There are features within some social media that could be more intuitive for users, particularly those features such as Reddit, which may be extremely confusing when a user first onboards. E.g. "Some features aren't self-explanatory. We get questions about how to find or use them, especially on Reddit. Making this more clear would help."
* Enhancement of engagement: There's a need to increase user engagement by further simplifying navigation across screens. "If we could make it easier to access features, I think people would use it more often. Right now, it's kind of buried in the menu options."
* Workflow efficiency: There's also a need to reduce the number of steps needed to complete common tasks, "It takes too many clicks to complete a simple action. Reducing this would make it more efficient for users who need to do this frequently."
* Further customization: Adding customization capabilities to allow user to tailor their experience based on individual preferences. E.g. "A lot of people have different needs, so it would be ideal if they could customize the view or layout to fit their preference better."
* Reduction on errors: Adding a clearer error reporting mechanism, will enable users to easily report issues they encounter. E.g. "Users sometimes encounter glitches, especially when going through feeds on Reddit. If we can reduce those, it'll make the experience more reliable."

Actions:
* Feature simplification: There's a recurring need to simplify features that currently require multiple steps, aligning with
the goal of efficiency.
E.g. "We need to simplify navigation in Reddit, maybe by removing redundant steps. It should
just be a straightforward process without extra screens."
* User guidance: Implementing in-app tutorials or hints will help users navigate complex features, addressing the
goal of feature clarity. E.g. ""Some sort of guided help would be beneficial. Like if we could have a short introduction or
prompt when they use a feature for the first time."
* Need to test for usability:  Conducting more comprehensive testing that is focused on real user scenarios to identify pain
points. E.g. "It would be helpful to test these features with actual users doing realistic tasks, not just our
internal teams, to catch any unexpected issues."
* Iterative feedback collection: Gathering ongoing feedback from users to continuously adapt the app based on their needs. E.g. "Gathering feedback periodically would let us know sooner if users are having trouble or if
their needs change."
* Optimization for performance: Improving the app's load times and responsiveness will prevent users from being frustrated, especially with high-engagement features. E.g. "One action we could take is optimizing load times. Some areas lag, especially on X, which can frustrate users."
* Error reporting and resolution: Adding a clearer reporting mechanism, will enable users to easily report issues they encounter. E.g. "Having a simple way to report errors directly from the app would be useful. This way, users don't have to leave feedback on another platform."

Goals:
* Create a Pull Request/Collaborate on tasks
* Review Code
* Create/Manage Issues
* View Other peoples code
* Save code backup on Github

Actions:
* Open github.com. Go to your profile. Open a Repository. Go to the Pull Requests Tab. Click on a green button called “new pull request”. Change one of the two branches. “Same branches can't be merged”. Click on “Create pull request”.
* Open Github.com. Go to profile. Open the repository where you want to. review code. Go to the pull requests tab. Open a pull request to review code. Open Files changed tab. See the changes in files that are going to be made. If changes look fine then click on review changes and then approve Pull Request. If changes dont look fine then click on review changes and either click on “add comments” for requesting the required changes or go to the conversation tab and click on decline Pull request.
* Open Github.com. Go to profile. Open the repository where you want to review code. Open the Issues tab. Click on New Issue button. Add a title to the issue. Add comments/description detailing the issue. Click on “Submit New” issue.
* Open Github.com. Go to the top search bar. Search for the repository/user/code you want to search. Press enter. Now on the search results tab either click on “Code”, “Repositories”, “User” whatever you want to search basically. Select from the sub results presented.
* Open Github.com. Go to profile. Click on the “+” icon. Click on new repository button from the drop down. Add repository name. Click on “create repository”.
* Upload code from local machine using commands listed by github on your machines terminal like - git remote add origin <repo url>, git branch -M main git, push -u origin main

﻿Goals:
* Save time when grocery shopping.
* Efficiently purchase specific grocery items that are needed weekly or bi-weekly.
* Add items to a grocery cart without having to manually select the specific store each time.
* Accurately estimate the quantities of individual grocery items.
* Easily identify relevant features from numerous options on the portal.
* Receive accurate recommendations for categories of items during exploration.
* Get the cheapest available alternative when a specific item is unavailable.
* Access flexible delivery options, including a pickup method.
* Create templates for different types of grocery lists.


Actions:
* The interviewee buys grocery items from an online grocery app if they are looking for specific items.
* The interviewee only explores new grocery items in person.
* The interviewee searches for specific products on the app.
* The interviewee manually selects the store for each item they want to buy.
* The interviewee goes through each item on the list and manually adds it to their cart.
* If an item is added to the wrong cart, the interviewee goes back to correct the store selection.
* The interviewee plans grocery purchases in advance by creating lists.
* The interviewee does not use the "buy again" feature unless it is explicitly recommended by the app.
* The interviewee reads the product description to determine the appropriate quantity to buy.
* The interviewee reviews the ingredients, brand, quantity, and price before adding a product to the cart.
* If they do not have a preferred product brand, the interviewee searches by product name and filters results by price before adding items to the cart.
* If a product is out of stock, the interviewee selects the next best alternative shown in the app based on the type and price of the product.
* The interviewee chooses not to replace an item if the alternative is more expensive than the originally intended item.
* The interviewee opts for the pick-up option to collect their grocery order.
* The interviewee does not view or edit account settings and information.
* The interviewee does not explore additional features offered by the app.
* If the interviewee forgets to order an item online, they physically go to the store to purchase it.

Goals:
* As a user, I want to be able to browse a web news platform for current news related to the economy, politics, and technology, so that I may stay up-to-date and can trade stocks effectively.
* As a user, I want my news platform to aggregate news from multiple news sources, so that I only have to go to this one web platform for my news and can be confident it is comprehensive.
* As a user, I want to be able to understand a news article at a high-level by reading a short summary, so that I don’t have to spend much time on an article that I am not interested in.
* As a user, I want to be able to save news articles to read later, so that I may peruse my entire feed first for articles that I am interested in before going back to read them in detail.
* As a user, I only want a news article to show up once in my feed even if it is published by multiple sources, so that I don’t waste time reading it twice.
* As a user, I would like to be able to organize my news articles I’ve saved for later, so that I can read the news about a certain topic before switching to another.
* As a user, I would like a news article to be marked as premium in my feed, so that I don’t click on the article if I’m not willing to pay for it.
* As a user, I would like my news feed to maintain its state even when I leave the page, so that my reading progress is not lost.
* As a user, I would like my preferred news platform to have a mobile app, so that I can use the platform when I am not on my computer.
* As a user, I would like the mobile application to have a reading mode that is capable of reading summaries of news articles from my news feed, so that I may browse my news feed while I am doing something else like driving in the car.

Actions:
* I will open the app and should be presented with my news feed. I will scroll down the feed that is tailored to my tastes.
* I will hover over the first article for a summary of the article.
* If I’m interested in reading the article further, then I will mark an article as something I want to read later by taking a simple action.
* I will navigate to the page with my news articles saved for later. If I’m only interested in reading about a particular topic, then I will filter for a topic or select one of my predefined lists.
* If I don’t have a subscription to the premium content and I don’t want to pay for one, then I will ignore articles with a premium tag and continue scrolling.
* I will open the app on my mobile phone. I will scroll down the feed that is tailored to my tastes.
* I will click the reading allowed feature and listen to summaries of articles in my feed.

Goals:
*  The customer should be able to get job updates on roles based on various criteria like skillsets, experience, projects, job location, visa status, etc.
*  Provide extensive filtering options to allow users to customize their job search through the criteria mentioned above.
*  Minimize the repitive actions by allowing direct applications through the app, without having to visit the company's website and potentially pre-filled data.
*  Integrate bookmarking system in the job portal applications itself or integration of third party applications like Notion etc.
*  Respect user's privacy where you don't share a users application with other applicants.
*  Display application status updates and employer responsiveness to give users a sense of progress and urgency in the application process.
*  Integration of AI tools to help users find jobs but not assistive in writing the application materials.

Actions:
*  Create a user-friendly interface that allows users to input their criteria and preferences.
*  Develop a robust search algorithm that can filter jobs based on the user's criteria.
*  Create a user interface such that it shows all the relevant details to the applicant easily the user does not have to find the details through heaps of text in the job description.
*  Design an automated alert system that delivers job updates matching the user’s specified preferences directly to their chosen channels (email, app notifications).
*  Design the mailing system in such a way that it doesn't spam the user and a mail that dosent get recognized as spam.
*  Integrate quick apply features that minimize repetitive data entry, possibly allowing users to save basic information for streamlined applications.
*  Include a feature for bookmarking job postings with the ability to set reminders and receive notifications when a bookmarked job is close to its application deadline.
*  Give options to the user to control the visibility of their applications and profile to other users.
*  Train and implement AI tools to analyze user preferences and job listings to provide personalized job recommendations without compromising user privacy.
*  Create and Design a flow where real-time updates are given on application status and, if possible, a rating of employer responsiveness, to help users prioritize follow-ups.
*  Designing a updates algorithm where if a user is actively seeking a job, send job updates instantly as new postings appear,else default to sending updates once a week.
*  Develop a system to send mobile notifications selectively, ensuring they are easily manageable and do not overwhelm the user’s notification tab.
*  Develop a system to send tailor job recommendations to closely match user-defined criteria to avoid sending irrelevant suggestions and if irrelevant job postings are send, give an option to the user to report the job posting as irrelevant.
*  Implement a feature that allows users to apply from other user's post where they can connect with the user posting about the hiring.

* Increasing financial literacy – Understanding how markets work.
* Gaining knowledge of advanced algorithms – Using these algorithms for improved trading.
* Exploring safer investment options – Interested in diversified options like mutual funds, if available on the app.
* Achieving seamless banking integration – A smoother, easier way to link accounts for ease of transaction.
* Learning through Zerodha Academy – Increasing knowledge through educational resources provided by the app.

Actions:
* Authenticating and logging in – Uses a PIN to access the Zerodha app.
* Viewing the watchlist – Keeps an eye on certain stocks of interest.
* Checking the portfolio dashboard – Reviews current investments and evaluates profit/loss status.
* Placing orders – Enters parameters like stock, price, and stop loss to execute trades.
* Setting up a monthly evaluation – Analyzes stocks monthly or bi-weekly to reallocate investments if necessary.
* Monitoring external news sources – Relies heavily on news and online sources to stay informed about market changes.
* Using portfolio dashboard frequently – This provides a daily summary of stock status, allowing the user to make quick assessments.
* Exploring cryptocurrency options like Binance – Uses it for crypto due to its easy interface and regulation management.
* Researching various apps before committing – Prefers apps that are user-friendly and have better integration with Indian banking systems.
* If a stock in the watchlist shows signs of consistent growth over several months, then the user may invest in it.
* If a large-cap stock doesn’t perform well over a six-month period, then they are inclined to sell it, assuming others may have insider knowledge.
* If an app doesn’t offer easy bank integration, then the user is unlikely to continue using it.
* If Zerodha had a voice command feature, then it would be preferred for faster checks without needing to open the app.
* Unless a new app has a unique, essential feature, then the user will likely stay with Zerodha due to the established system setup.

Goals
* Practice coding questions to prepare for job interviews and improve coding skills.
* Achieve a good score in a computer contest to strengthen university applications.
* Use platforms like LeetCode and NeetCode for practicing coding questions to gain confidence and improve speed.
* Practice coding questions in specific categories (e.g., arrays, trees, dynamic programming) to master them.
* Measure and track progress by the number of questions completed and time taken to solve each one.
* Participate in weekly coding contests on LeetCode for further practice, although he generally avoids the formal contest environment due to stress.
* Strengthen problem-solving skills by engaging with unfamiliar problem types and algorithms.
* Understand problem-solving approaches by viewing solutions when stuck.

Actions
* Platform Selection and Usage:
* Used HackerRank, then transitioned to LeetCode based on friends' recommendations.
* Selects problems from LeetCode or NeetCode depending on goals (e.g., general practice vs. job interview preparation).
* Practice Approach: Focuses on specific problem categories to build expertise. Sets milestones to complete all questions in a chosen category. Chooses problem difficulty based on mood and practice goals (e.g., easy questions when in a bad mood or tired, harder questions for a challenge).
* Problem-Solving Routine: Allocates a “chunk of time” for coding practice to ensure focus without distractions. Times each problem to gauge progress and ensure efficiency. Uses a rough guideline: easy questions (10 minutes), medium questions (20–30 minutes), and hard questions (up to an hour).
* Progress Evaluation: Tracks progress using platform metrics, such as the number of questions completed (a check) and time spent on each. Sets personal time benchmarks for medium and hard questions to monitor improvement. Reassesses progress by revisiting previously solved problems or attempting new ones in different categories.
* Learning Strategy: If stuck on a problem for more than an hour, then just checkout the solution to understand the approach and learn the optimal solution. Revisits difficult problems to reinforce understanding and remember solution patterns.
* Weekly Contests Participation: Engages with weekly contest problems but generally does not join live contests unless he is free. Uses contest questions to simulate interview conditions and develop adaptability to different question styles.
* Advice and Insights for Beginners: Recommends starting with easy-to-medium questions and progressively moving to harder ones. Don’t spend too much time on a single problem without checking solutions to prevent frustration.

Send an attached note along with the connection request that says that I am currently a student at the university, thereby increasing my chances of getting a referral due to the alumni network.

Goals:

* Browse content visually

Actions:
* Click on the central search bar at the top of the screen. Type in keywords or text related to the desired content. Press Enter or click the search button (magnifying glass icon). Scroll through the search results, ordered by relevancy to search criteria. Click on a video thumbnail to view more details or play the video
* Navigate to the home screen with relevant videos. Scroll through thumbnails on the home screen, some with longer descriptions. Click on arrows to navigate through content.
* Click on the creation button (plus sign in video camera icon). Select "Upload video" from the dropdown menu. Click on the "Create" button in the center of the page. Choose a video file from your computer to upload. Enter a title for the video in the provided text box. Add a description for the video in the designated area. Select appropriate language. Click the "Publish" button to finish uploading the video.
* Click on a video to add it to the watch list. Navigate to a creator's channel page. Click the "Subscribe" button to follow a channel. Click on the subscriptions tab in the left sidebar. Scroll through the latest content from subscribed channels. Use filters or sorting options to organize subscribed content. Remove videos from watch list if no longer interested. Unsubscribe from channels if desired.
* Find the video player controls at the bottom of the video. Find the play/pause button on the left side of the control bar and click to toggle between play and pause. Find the "next" button to the right of the play/pause button and click to go to the next suggested video. Find the mute/unmute button next to the "next" button, and click to toggle audio on or off. Find the volume slider to the right of the mute/unmute button, and click and drag to adjust volume manually. Observe the time displayed showing current time and total video length. Locate the captions button and click to enable or disable captions. Find and click on the settings menu for additional options. Locate the full screen toggle on the far right, and click to enter or exit full screen mode.

Goals:
* Daily Weather Check: The user wants to check the temperature daily to decide on clothing and transportation, such as using a bike or bus.
* Rain Forecast Monitoring: To prepare for rain, the user checks precipitation probabilities, ensuring they carry an umbrella if necessary.
* Weather Alerts for Extreme Conditions: In cases of severe weather events, they rely on weather.com to provide essential safety information.
* Trip Planning: For travel, the user looks at long-term forecasts, including cloud coverage, temperature, and historical weather data, to adjust plans.
* Interest in Advanced Radar Features: They would use weather.com more if it offered a detailed radar with interactive animations like other weather apps.


Actions:
* Checking temperature and precipitation levels for the day.
* Googling “weather.com” and accessing it from the first few links.
* Looking at hourly forecasts, especially around the time they’ll be outdoors.
* Using pre-set location data to pull up relevant weather without manual adjustments.
* Verifying extreme weather notifications, if any.
* Referencing weather data during the decision-making process, especially for wardrobe and transportation.
* Checking other parameters like cloud coverage and UV index through the app’s detailed view.
* Reviewing radar data for interest, although noting its limitations on weather.com.
* Considering alternative weather sources, like windy.com, for radar animations.
* Disabling notifications to avoid unnecessary updates.
* Adjusting the temperature setting from Fahrenheit to Celsius when accessing weather data.
* Occasionally exploring other cities’ weather for potential travel.
* Identifying, but not engaging with, ads that disrupt the app’s user experience.
* Exploring other apps for more precise location-based weather if needed.
* Checking government sources or alternative channels for extreme weather updates if weather.com lacks sufficient information.

Goals, Actions, and Obstacles

Goals:
* Efficiently Manage Code on Different Machines and Servers
* Customize the Editor to Personal Preferences
* Customize the editor and plugin
* Editor should be Lightweight
* Leverage Community Support to Enhance Functionality
* Ensure Portability Across Development Environments
* Integrate Development Tools Within the Editor
* Integrate commonly done work into the editor

Actions
* Open editor directly on a terminal (an interface to directly talk to the machine). Open files and folders in the editor. Modify and save changes. If working on a server without an Interface, then use the editor to modify code without additional setup.
* Go to community spaces. Get plugin (enhancement) information. Open editor configuration file. Add information to the editor configuration file. Use the plugin in the editor.
* Edit plugin file. Add keyboard shortcuts for easy access; otherwise, navigation may be slower
* Do not include many functionalities right out of the box, otherwise editor will be slower than expected. If the user wants to add more functionality, then they can add plugins (mentioned above). Only add things that you want.
* Get the community to participate in improving the editor. Make content for the community. Access community resources like YouTube tutorials and Stack Overflow. Participate in forums to share knowledge and discover new plugins. If the community suggests certain plugins, then you can install them instantly.
* Make the editor configuration file simple to use. Transfer and run configuration file from any device; otherwise, settings may not be consistent across environments. Load the same editor from any device with this configuration file.
* Integrate tools like Tmux (tool to split terminal into multiple terminals) into working well with the editor. Build multiple plugins to support different functionality
* Develop commonly used functionality like code reviewing tools, monitoring tools. Add these as plugins. Let users install and customize their editor to do more; otherwise, they may lack the necessary features.

Goals:
* Find Job Opportunities: Identify and apply for relevant positions
* Expand Professional Network: Connect with industry professionals and peers to enhance networking opportunities.
* Monitoring Industry Trends with LinkedIn’s feed and professional groups to follow industry developments.
* Access and Manage Job Recommendations: Receive job alerts and customize notifications for relevant roles.
* Manage LinkedIn Profile: Keep profile current to increase job search effectiveness and signal openness to jobs.

Actions:
* Search for Jobs on LinkedIn. Go to the "Jobs" tab. Type keywords and location in search bar. Apply filters (e.g., date posted, experience level). Click “Easy Apply”.
* Set Up Job Alerts. Toggle "Get job alerts for this search" for filter-based notifications. Select "Preferences". Set alert frequency. Select alert method (e.g., in-app or email).
* Engage with LinkedIn Feed: Browse the "Home" tab. Like, comment, or share posts.
* Connect with people: If known, search by name otherwise find in groups. Send connection request 
* Find and Join Groups: Click "My Network" tab. Scroll to "Groups You May Be Interested In." View suggested groups. 'Join' relevant group
* Access Saved Jobs: Go to "My Jobs" in the "Jobs" tab. View saved jobs.
* Update Profile: Click on the profile picture. Select "View Profile." Use “Add Section” to update sections like About, Education, or Experience. Mark profile as “Open to Work”

)] ) achieve_send_messages_to_contacts = AchieveGoal( name="MessagesSentToContacts", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_compose_message, achieve_send_message, SmallFileSize and SizeLessThan25MB", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( file_sender, file_sends )] ) achieve_file_size_less_than_25MB = AchieveGoal( name="FileSizeLessThan25MB if SmallFileSize", achieve_file_size_less_than_25MB, maintain_small_file_size ], annotation="Tactic: guard introduction" )] ) file_link_sender = Agent("Sender", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) send_link = Operation("sendLink", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) achieve_file_link_sent = AchieveGoal( name="ThirdPartyFileLinkSent if LargeFileSize", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( file_link_sender, send_link )] ) achieve_transfer_files_to_contacts = AchieveGoal( name="FilesTransferedToContacts", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_file_sent, achieve_file_link_sent ], annotation="Tactic: decomposition by cases" )] ) achieve_efficient_message_exchange = AchieveGoal( name="EfficientMessageExchange", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_send_messages_to_contacts, achieve_transfer_files_to_contacts ] )] ) searcher1 = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) search1 = Operation("search", performs=[PerformanceLink( searcher1, search1 )] ) achieve_search_for_messages = AchieveGoal( name="MessagesFound", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( searcher2, search2 )] ) achieve_search_for_images = AchieveGoal( name="ImagesFound", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( searcher3, search3 )] ) achieve_effective_content_search = AchieveGoal( name="EffectiveContentSearch", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_search_for_contacts, achieve_search_for_messages, achieve_search_for_images ] )] ) organizer1 = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) organize1 = Operation("search", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) organizer2 = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) organize2 = Operation("search", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) achieve_pin_conversations = AchieveGoal( name="PinConversations if Important", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( organizer1, organize1 )] ) achieve_archive_conversations = AchieveGoal( name="ArchiveConversations if not Important", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( organizer2, organize2 )] ) maintain_organized_conversations = MaintainGoal( name="OrganizedConversations", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_pin_conversations, achieve_archive_conversations, ], annotation="Tactic: decomposition by cases" )] ) transferer = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) transfer = Operation("transfer", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) backup_system = Agent("BackupSystem", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) backup = Operation("backup", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) automatic_data_sync = AchieveGoal( name="AutomaticDataSync", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink( backup_system, backup )] ) performs=[performance_links["profile_watched"]], leaf=True) maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store_liked = MaintainGoal( name="StoreLikedVideos", performs=[performance_links["profile_liked"]], leaf=True) maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store = MaintainGoal( name="StoreHistoryForWatchedVideosAndLikes", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store_watched, maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store_liked] )], annotation="This is a usage of the divide-and-conquer refinement pattern." ) achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos_findgenre = AchieveGoal( name="FindNewGenresThatUserMightLike", performs=[performance_links["recommender_genres"]], leaf=True) avoid_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos_notfindgenre = AvoidGoal( name="AvoidGenresUserMightNotLike", performs=[performance_links["recommender_avoid_genres"]], leaf=True, annotation="Represents an avoid goal.") achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos_findcreators = AchieveGoal( name="FindNewCreatorsThatUserMightLikeInAlreadyLikedGenres", performs=[performance_links["recommender_creators"]], leaf=True) avoid_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos_notfindcreators = AvoidGoal( name="AvoidCreatorsThatUserHasAlreadyLiked", performs=[performance_links["recommender_avoid_creators"]], leaf=True) # L4 ///////////////////////////////////////// achieve_personalization_related_liked_analyze = AchieveGoal( name="AnalyzeLikedVideoPatterns", performs=[performance_links["analyzer_liked"]], leaf=True) achieve_personalization_related_liked_filter = AchieveGoal( name="FilterSimilarContentToLiked", performs=[performance_links["recommender_similar"]], leaf=True) avoid_personalization_related_liked_duplicates = avoid_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos_notfindcreators achieve_personalization_related_history_analyze = AchieveGoal( name="AnalyzeViewingPatterns", performs=[performance_links["analyzer_viewing"]], leaf=True) avoid_personalization_related_history_disliked = AvoidGoal( name="AvoidPreviouslyDislikedContent", performs=[performance_links["profile_disliked"]], leaf=True) maintain_personalization_related_similar_users = MaintainGoal( name="DetailsOfUsersWithSimilarTaste", performs=[performance_links["recommender_similar"]], leaf=True) achieve_personalization_related_similar_preferred = AchieveGoal( name="ChoosePreferredVideosByUsersWithSimilarTests", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store])]) achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos = AchieveGoal( name="FindVideosInNewLikableGenres", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos_findgenre, avoid_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos_notfindgenre])], annotation="This is a usage of the milestone refinement pattern. It doesn't use the 'if then...sooner-or-later' but still follows the essence of the milestone pattern.") achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos = AchieveGoal( name="FindVideosByNewCreatorsInAlreadyLikedGenres", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos_findcreators, avoid_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos_notfindcreators])]) # L3 ///////////////////////////////////////// achieve_personalization_related_liked = AchieveGoal( name="RecommendBasedOnPreviouslyLikedVideos", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[ maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store_liked, achieve_personalization_related_liked_analyze, achieve_personalization_related_liked_filter, avoid_personalization_related_liked_duplicates ], annotation="Represents a complete AND refinement." ) ]) maintain_personalization_related_history = MaintainGoal( name="RecommendBasedOnViewingHistory", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[ maintain_personalization_related_similar_preferred_store_watched, achieve_personalization_related_history_analyze, avoid_personalization_related_history_disliked ] ) ]) achieve_personalization_related_similar = AchieveGoal( name="RecommendBasedOnVideosLikedByOtherUsersWithSimilarTastes", refinements=[Refinement(complete=False, children=[maintain_personalization_related_similar_users, achieve_personalization_related_similar_preferred], annotation="Represents an incomplete AND refinement.") ]) achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre = AchieveGoal( name="SuggestContentFromNewGenres", refinements=[Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre_findvideos])] ) achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels = AchieveGoal( name="SuggestNewContentInCurrentlyWatchedGenres", refinements=[Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels_findvideos])]) # L2 ///////////////////////////////////////// achieve_personalization_related = AchieveGoal(name="FindReleventVideos", refinements=[Refinement( complete=False, children=[achieve_personalization_related_liked, maintain_personalization_related_history, achieve_personalization_related_similar])]) achieve_personalization_new = AchieveGoal(name="FindFreshContent", refinements=[Refinement( complete=False, children=[ achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre] ), Refinement( complete=False, children=[ achieve_personalization_new_differentchannels ] )]) # L1 ///////////////////////////////////////// achieve_personalization = AchieveGoal( name="PersonalizationAndContentDiscovery", refinements=[Refinement( complete=False, children=[achieve_personalization_related]), Refinement( complete=False, children=[achieve_personalization_new])], annotation="This is a usage of the H4 - Ask HOW and WHY heuristic.") # Graph 2 # L3/4 ///////////////////////////// achieve_meditation_content = AchieveGoal(name="FindMeditationContent", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ achieve_personalization_related_liked, maintain_personalization_related_history ]) ]) achieve_morning_routine = AchieveGoal( name="SuggestMorningRoutineVideos", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ achieve_meditation_content, achieve_personalization_related_similar ]) ], annotation="Represents a functional goal.") achieve_short_entertaining = AchieveGoal(name="FindEntertainingShortContent", performs=[performance_links["recommender_short"], performance_links["recommender_avoid_long"]]) maintain_attention_span = MaintainGoal( name="EnsureContentUnder5Minutes", performs=[performance_links["recommender_avoid_long"]], leaf=True) avoid_long_content = AvoidGoal( name="AvoidLongFormContent", performs=[performance_links["recommender_avoid_long"]], leaf=True ) maintain_morning_preferences = MaintainGoal( name="MorningViewingPreferences", performs=[performance_links["profile_morning"]], leaf=True ) achieve_morning_reminders = AchieveGoal( name="SetMorningViewingReminders", performs=[performance_links["notification_reminders"]], leaf=True ) achieve_genre_switch = AchieveGoal(name="SuggestDifferentGenre", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre, avoid_personalization_related_history_disliked ]) ]) maintain_engagement = MaintainGoal( name="MaintainUserEngagement", performs=[performance_links["notification_engagement"], performance_links["notification_reminders"]], leaf=True, annotation="Represents an maintain goal, which is a type of behavioral goal." ) # L1/2 ///////////////////////////// achieve_relaxation_wakeup = AchieveGoal(name="RelaxAfterWakingUpFromSleep", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ maintain_morning_preferences, achieve_morning_reminders, achieve_morning_routine ]) ], annotation="This is a usage of the H5 - split responsibility heuristic.") achieve_relaxation_bored = AchieveGoal(name="RelaxWhenBored", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ achieve_genre_switch, maintain_engagement, achieve_personalization_related_similar ]) ]) achieve_relaxation_quick = AchieveGoal(name="RelaxForAShortTime", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[ achieve_short_entertaining, maintain_attention_span, avoid_long_content, achieve_personalization_related_liked ]) ], annotation="Represents an achieve goal.") soft_relaxation = SoftGoal( name="MaximizeRelaxation", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_relaxation_wakeup]), Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_relaxation_bored]), Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_relaxation_quick])], annotation="Represents a soft goal, a non functional goal, and an OR refinement. This is also a usage of the Decomposition-by-case refinement pattern.") # Conflict conflict = ConflictLink( goal1=achieve_personalization_new_differentgenre, goal2=maintain_personalization_related_history ) # Generate the graph output = generate_graph([soft_relaxation, achieve_personalization], [conflict]) print("Mermaid Diagram Definition:") print(output) from goalmodeling.schema import * # Define the agents user = Agent('User', AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) ai_parser = Agent('AI Parser', AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) packet_transmitter = Agent('Packet Transmitter', AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) packet_marshaller = Agent('Packet Marshaller', AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) # Define operations notification_enable = Operation('Enable PUSH notification', OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) add_label_op = Operation('Add Label', OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) add_auto_label_op = Operation('System Add Label', OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) send_message_op = Operation('Hit Send', OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) delete_message_op = Operation('Hit Delete', OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) avoid_packet_marshalling_loss_op = Operation('Ensure integrity of marshalled packets', OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) avoid_packet_transmission_loss_op = Operation('Retransmit lost packets', OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) # Define performance links enable_notifs_process = PerformanceLink(user, notification_enable) hit_send = PerformanceLink(user, send_message_op) hit_delete = PerformanceLink(user, delete_message_op) add_label_process = PerformanceLink(user, add_label_op) add_auto_label_process = PerformanceLink(ai_parser, add_auto_label_op) avoid_packet_marshalling_loss_process = PerformanceLink(packet_marshaller, avoid_packet_marshalling_loss_op) avoid_packet_transmission_loss_process = PerformanceLink(packet_transmitter, avoid_packet_transmission_loss_op) send_message = AchieveGoal( name="Send message", leaf=True, performs=[hit_send] ) send_notifications = AchieveGoal( name="Receive msg and send notification if notifications enabled", performs=[enable_notifs_process], leaf=True ) not_send_notifications = AchieveGoal( name="Receive msg but don't send notification if notifications not enabled", leaf = True, ) # Mid-level goals with refinements receive_message = AchieveGoal( name="Receive message", # AND refinement refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[send_notifications, not_send_notifications] ) ], annotation="Pattern: Decomposition by cases (cases: send notifs, don't send notifs)" ) minimize_packet_loss = AvoidGoal( name = "Packet loss", leaf = True, performs=[avoid_packet_marshalling_loss_process, avoid_packet_transmission_loss_process], annotation="Heuristic: H5 Split Responsibilities" ) minimize_bytes_loss = AvoidGoal( name = "Bytes loss", leaf = True ) minimize_order_mismatch = AvoidGoal( name = "Bit order mismatch", leaf = True ) avoid_data_corruption = AvoidGoal( name = "Data Corruption", # OR refinement refinements=[ Refinement( complete=False, children=[minimize_packet_loss, minimize_bytes_loss] ), Refinement( complete=False, children=[minimize_order_mismatch] ) ], annotation="OR Refinement" ) maximize_reliability = SoftGoal( name = "Maximize Reliability", leaf=True, annotation="Heuristic: H3 Instantiate Goal Categories - Soft Goal" ) communicate_message = AchieveGoal( name="Communicate message", refinements=[ # AND refinement Refinement( complete=True, children=[send_message, receive_message, avoid_data_corruption, maximize_reliability] ) ] ) manual_categorize = AchieveGoal( name="Add tag manually", leaf=True, performs = [add_label_process] ) process_message = AchieveGoal( name="Process message", leaf=True, performs = [add_auto_label_process] ) auto_categorize = AchieveGoal( name="Add system tag", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[process_message] ) ] ) categorize_message = AchieveGoal( name="Categorize message", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[manual_categorize, auto_categorize] ) ], annotation="Pattern: Milestone-driven" ) save_message = AchieveGoal( name="Save message in appropriate folder", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[categorize_message] ) ] ) delete_message = AchieveGoal( name="Delete message", leaf = True, performs=[hit_delete] ) store_message = AchieveGoal( name="Manage message persistence", refinements=[ # AND refinement using milestone-driven pattern Refinement( complete=True, children = [save_message, delete_message] ) ], annotation="AND Refinement; \n Pattern: Divide and Conquer" ) minimize_distractions = MaintainGoal( name="Minimize Distractions", leaf=True ) # Root-level goal manage_persistent_communication = AchieveGoal( name="Manage communication persistently", refinements=[ # AND refinement at the top level Refinement( complete=True, children=[ communicate_message, store_message ] ) ], annotation="Heuristic: H4 HOW - WHY questions" ) # Generate the goal model if __name__ == "__main__": # Create a conflict link between notification goals and minimize distractions conflicts = [ ConflictLink(send_notifications, minimize_distractions), ConflictLink(auto_categorize, manual_categorize) ] # Generate the graph output = generate_graph([manage_persistent_communication], conflicts) print(output) # Generate a link to view in Mermaid Live Editor config = { "theme": "default", "themeVariables": { "fontFamily": "Helvetica" } } link = generate_pako_link(output, "edit", config=config) Functional Goal: Ensures the application is the user's overall preference. preference_goal = AchieveGoal(name="Their web application is their overall preference") # Functional Goal: Provides access to diverse content like shows and movies. content_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants to watch content such as shows and movies") # Non-Functional Goal (Soft Goal): Focuses on personalized recommendations to meet user interests. personalized_content_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants to watch personalized content to meet their interests") # Functional Goal: Allows users to save content for future use. save_content_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants to save content for future use") # Behavioral Goal: Requires user interaction with an interface to preview content. interactive_ui_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants an interactive UI to watch small clips to understand content") # Non-Functional Goal (Soft Goal): Enhances the user's efficiency in finding desired content. efficiency_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants improved efficiency in finding content") # Behavioral Goal: Encourages weekly engagement with the application. weekly_use_goal = MaintainGoal(name="The user uses the application on a weekly basis") # Soft Goal: Ensures the application provides an entertaining experience. entertainment_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user uses the application for entertainment") # Conflict Goal: Highlights a conflict if users rely on YouTube instead of Netflix for trailers. youtube_trailers_goal = AvoidGoal(name="The user uses YouTube for Netflix content if Netflix lacks a trailer") # Functional Goal with Guard Introduction: Allows resuming content only when conditions are met. resume_content_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user wants to resume watching content at another time") # Functional Goal with OR-Refinement: Provides alternatives if content is missing on Netflix. other_platform_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user may use other streaming apps if Netflix lacks content") # Functional Goal: Allows switching to other platforms if content is removed. content_removed_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user switches to other platforms if content is removed") # Soft Goal: Ensures users can rewatch content easily. convenience_goal = AchieveGoal(name="The user likes rewatching content at their convenience") # First-level Refinements with annotated patterns applied # Combines goals to ensure the application becomes the user's preference. preference_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Preference Refinements", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[content_goal, entertainment_goal, efficiency_goal] )] ) # OR-Refinement: Provides diverse ways to meet user needs content_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Content Refinements", refinements=[Refinement( complete=False, # OR-refinement applied here. children=[save_content_goal, personalized_content_goal, convenience_goal] )] ) # Divide-and-Conquer: Breaks down UI improvements into smaller, focused goals. interactive_ui_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Interactive UI Refinement", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[interactive_ui_goal, efficiency_goal] )] ) # Guard Introduction: Applies conditions for resuming saved content. save_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Save Content Refinement", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[resume_content_goal, convenience_goal] )] ) # Decomposition-by-Case: Breaks efficiency into weekly use and resuming content. efficiency_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Efficiency Refinement", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[weekly_use_goal, resume_content_goal] )] ) # Conflict: Switching platforms if content is removed conflicts with retaining users on Netflix. # Milestone-Driven: First ensures flexibility within Netflix, then allows switching platforms. platform_flexibility_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Platform Flexibility Refinement", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[other_platform_goal, content_removed_goal] )] ) ## Higher-level Grouped Refinements # Groups refinements that enhance user experience user_experience_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="User Experience Goals", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[preference_refinement, efficiency_refinement, convenience_goal] )] ) # Groups refinements for accessing content (OR-refinement applied for diverse options) content_access_refinement = AchieveGoal( name = "Content Access Goals", refinements = [Refinement( complete=True, children=[content_refinement, save_refinement, resume_content_goal] )] ) # Adds flexibility by addressing missing content platform_refinement = AchieveGoal( name = "Platform Flexibility Goals", refinements = [Refinement( complete=True, children=[platform_flexibility_refinement, youtube_trailers_goal] )] ) ## Overarching Categories # Combines goals that directly enhance user satisfaction. user_centric_goals = AchieveGoal( name = "User-Centric Goals", refinements = [Refinement( complete=True, children=[user_experience_refinement, content_access_refinement] )] ) # Combines goals related to content flexibility and access. content_centric_goals = AchieveGoal( name = "Content-Centric Goals", refinements = [Refinement( complete=True, children=[platform_refinement, content_refinement] )] ) # Final graph output = generate_graph([ user_centric_goals, content_centric_goals ], []) print(output) config = {"theme": "default", "themeVariables": {"fontFamily": "Helvetica"}} link = generate_pako_link(output, "edit", Operations send_job_updates = Operation( name="Send Job Updates", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) direct_application = Operation( name="Enable Direct Application", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) manage_bookmarks = Operation( name="Manage Bookmarked Jobs", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) provide_notifications = Operation( name="Send Notifications", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) generate_recommendations = Operation( name="Generate Job Recommendations", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) monitor_application_status = Operation( name="Track Application Status", category=OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION ) share_job_posts = Operation( name="Share Job Postings", category=OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION ) # Define Agents user = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) platform = Agent("Job Portal Platform", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) # Define Goals job_updates = AchieveGoal( name="Provide Relevant Job Updates", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, send_job_updates)], annotation="H1: High-Level Goal Refinement" ) direct_application_goal = AchieveGoal( name="Direct Application Feature", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, direct_application)], annotation="H2: Direct Application Refinement" ) bookmark_management = MaintainGoal( name="Bookmark Management", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, manage_bookmarks)], annotation="H3: Maintain Bookmarks for User Access" ) personalized_recommendations = AchieveGoal( name="Provide Personalized Recommendations", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, generate_recommendations)], annotation="H4: Personalized Job Suggestions" ) real_time_updates = AchieveGoal( name="Real-time Job Updates for Active Job Seekers", annotation="H5: AND Refinement" ) weekly_updates = AchieveGoal( name="Weekly Job Updates for Passive Seekers", annotation="H6: AND Refinement" ) alert_management = MaintainGoal( name="Controlled Alerts and Notifications", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, provide_notifications)], annotation="H7: Control Alert Frequency" ) application_status_tracking = AchieveGoal( name="Track Application Status Progress", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, monitor_application_status)], annotation="H8: Track and Notify Application Progress" ) visibility_control = MaintainGoal( name="User Profile and Application Visibility Control", annotation="H9: Privacy Refinement" ) user_engagement = AchieveGoal( name="Enable User Engagement Through Post Applications", performs=[PerformanceLink(user, share_job_posts)], annotation="H10: Enable Social Application Options" ) # Define Soft Goals (Increasing number of Soft Goals) enhance_personalization = SoftGoal( name="Enhance Personalization", refinements=[Refinement(False, [personalized_recommendations])], annotation="Soft Goal: Personalization" ) boost_engagement = SoftGoal( name="Boost User Engagement", refinements=[Refinement(True, [user_engagement, alert_management])], annotation="Soft Goal: Engagement" ) improve_privacy = SoftGoal( name="Enhance User Privacy", refinements=[Refinement(False, [visibility_control])], annotation="Soft Goal: Privacy" ) reduce_alert_overload = SoftGoal( name="Reduce Alert Overload", refinements=[Refinement(False, [alert_management])], annotation="Soft Goal: Reduce Alerts" ) # Define Refinements (AND / OR / Specific Refinement Patterns) update_algorithm = AchieveGoal( name="Timely Job Updates", refinements=[ Refinement(True, [real_time_updates, weekly_updates]) ], annotation="H11: Algorithm Refinement for Timely Updates" ) user_notifications = AchieveGoal( name="User Notifications for Job Matches", refinements=[Refinement(True, [alert_management, application_status_tracking])], annotation="H12: AND Refinement" ) recommendation_system = AchieveGoal( name="Advanced Recommendation System", refinements=[ Refinement(False, [personalized_recommendations]) ], annotation="OR Refinement for Recommendations" ) # Decomposition-by-case refinement case_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Apply Case-specific Job Updates", annotation="Decomposition-by-case refinement: Different cases for updates" ) # Divide-and-conquer refinement (Maintain goal) divide_and_conquer_refinement = MaintainGoal( name="Preserve User Experience", refinements=[Refinement(True, [user_notifications, visibility_control])], annotation="Divide-and-conquer: Ensure a great user experience" ) # Unmonitorability-driven refinement unmonitorability_refinement = AchieveGoal( name="Resolve Unmonitorability for Job Updates", annotation="Unmonitorability-driven refinement: Resolve issues" ) # High-level Goal comprehensive_job_portal = AchieveGoal( name="Comprehensive Job Portal Experience", refinements=[Refinement(True, [ job_updates, direct_application_goal, bookmark_management, recommendation_system, update_algorithm, user_notifications, visibility_control, user_engagement ])], annotation="H13: High-Level Goal for Job Portal" ) # Define Obstacles for Obstruction Links alert_overload = Obstacle(name="Alert Overload") # Connections - Supported Links Only obstruction_link = ObstructionLink( goal=alert_management, obstacle=alert_overload ) conflict_link = ConflictLink( goal1=boost_engagement, goal2=enhance_personalization ) # Generate Graph and Save Output to File output = generate_graph( [comprehensive_job_portal, enhance_personalization, boost_engagement, improve_privacy, reduce_alert_overload], [obstruction_link, conflict_link] ) # Saving the diagram output into a file with open("job_portal_diagram_output.txt", "w") as file: file.write(output) print(output) print(generate_pako_link(output)) job_portal_goal_model() from goalmodeling.schema import * def weather_goal_model(host="https://mermaid.live"): # Agents user_agent = Agent("User", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT, annotation="User performing weather checks") agent_user1 = Agent("User", Operations for the agent actions enable_voice_assistant_operation = Operation("Enable Voice Assistant", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) check_notifications_operation = Operation("Check Device Notifications", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) send_hail_update_operation = Operation("Publish Hail Update", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) send_tornado_update_operation = Operation("Publish Tornado Update", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) send_drought_update_operation = Operation("Publish Drought Update", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) # Goals and Subgoals achieve_get_forecast_information = AchieveGoal( name="GetForecastInformation", annotation="Decomposition heuristic", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ AchieveGoal("ReferWeeklyForecasts", leaf=True) ]), Refinement(complete=False, children=[ AchieveGoal("ReferDailyForecastsForOutdoorPlans", leaf=True) ]), ] ) achieve_receive_timely_updates_for_extreme_weather = AchieveGoal( name="ReceiveUpdatesForExtremeWeather", annotation="Milestone-driven heuristic", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ AchieveGoal("SendUpdateForHail", performs=[PerformanceLink(system_agent_hail, send_hail_update_operation)], leaf=True), AchieveGoal("SendUpdateForTornado", performs=[PerformanceLink(system_agent_tornado, send_tornado_update_operation)], leaf=True), AchieveGoal("SendUpdateForDrought", performs=[PerformanceLink(system_agent_drought, send_drought_update_operation)], leaf=True) ]) ] ) achieve_open_app_to_check_weather = AchieveGoal( name="OpenAppToCheckWeather", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ AchieveGoal("CheckTemperature", leaf=True), AchieveGoal("CheckPrecipitation", leaf=True) ]) ] ) achieve_stay_prepared_for_everyday_weather = AchieveGoal( name="GetWeatherInformation", annotation="Functional goal - Information", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ achieve_open_app_to_check_weather, SoftGoal("MaximizeAccuracyOver95%", annotation="Soft goal"), AchieveGoal("AskAssistantForWeather", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ AchieveGoal("EnableVoiceAssistantOnDevice", annotation="Guard-introduction heuristic", performs=[PerformanceLink(agent_user1, enable_voice_assistant_operation)], leaf=True) ]) ]), MaintainGoal("MaintainAvailability", annotation="Behavioral - Maintainance") ]) ] ) achieve_rely_on_real_time_weather_updates = AchieveGoal( name="GetRealTimeWeatherUpdates", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ achieve_receive_timely_updates_for_extreme_weather, AchieveGoal("CheckDeviceNotificationsDuringDay", annotation="Non Functional - Quality of Service (Availability)", performs=[PerformanceLink(agent_user2, check_notifications_operation)], leaf=True) ]) ] ) # Main goal for generating the graph achieve_weather_goal = AchieveGoal( name="UseWeatherToPlanTrip", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=False, children=[ achieve_get_forecast_information, achieve_stay_prepared_for_everyday_weather, achieve_rely_on_real_time_weather_updates ]) ] ) # Generating and printing the graph output = generate_graph([achieve_weather_goal], []) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) print(output) print() print(link) if __name__ == "__main__": weather_goal_model() from goalmodeling.schema import * # Agents investor = upload_video(host="https://mermaid.live"): """Models the video upload process with milestone-driven pattern""" # Actors uploader = Agent("Uploader", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) platform = Agent("Platform", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) # Operations for file selection and upload click_create_button = Operation("Click Create Button", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) select_upload_option = Operation("Select Upload Option", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) choose_file = Operation("Choose Video File", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) validate_file = Operation("Validate File Format", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) # Low level goals for file handling achieve_clicked_upload = AchieveGoal( "ClickedUploadButton", [PerformanceLink(uploader, click_create_button)] ) achieve_selected_upload = AchieveGoal( "SelectedUploadOption", [PerformanceLink(uploader, select_upload_option)] ) achieve_chose_file = AchieveGoal( "ChoseVideoFile", [PerformanceLink(uploader, choose_file)] ) achieve_validated_file = AchieveGoal( "ValidatedFileFormatFromUploadInitiation", [PerformanceLink(platform, validate_file)] ) # Mid level goals with decomposition-by-case pattern achieve_initiated_upload = AchieveGoal( "InitiatedUploadFromChoice", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[achieve_clicked_upload, achieve_selected_upload] )], annotation="Heuristic: Identifying goals along refinement branches" ) # Video metadata operations enter_title = Operation("Enter Video Title", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) enter_description = Operation("Enter Video Description", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) select_language = Operation("Select Language", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) achieve_entered_title = AchieveGoal( "EnteredTitle", [PerformanceLink(uploader, enter_title)] ) achieve_entered_description = AchieveGoal( "EnteredDescription", [PerformanceLink(uploader, enter_description)] ) achieve_selected_language = AchieveGoal( "SelectedLanguage", [PerformanceLink(uploader, select_language)] ) # Mid level metadata goal with divide-and-conquer pattern achieve_entered_metadata = AchieveGoal( "EnteredMetadataFromUploadedVideo", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[achieve_entered_title, achieve_entered_description, achieve_selected_language] )], annotation="Heuristic: Identifying goals along refinement branches" ) # Publishing operation click_publish = Operation("Click Publish", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) process_upload = Operation("Process Upload", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) achieve_clicked_publish = AchieveGoal( "ClickedPublishFromMetadataEntry", [PerformanceLink(uploader, click_publish)] ) maintain_upload_progress = MaintainGoal( "MaintainUploadProgressFromValidation", [PerformanceLink(platform, process_upload)], annotation="H3: Instantiate Goal Categories" ) achieve_uploaded_video = AchieveGoal( "UploadedVideoFromMaintainingProgress", [PerformanceLink(platform, maintain_upload_progress)] ) upload_milestone_refinement = Refinement( complete=True, children=[ achieve_initiated_upload, achieve_chose_file, achieve_validated_file, achieve_entered_metadata, achieve_clicked_publish, maintain_upload_progress, achieve_uploaded_video ] ) # High level goal - milestone driven pattern achieve_published_video = AchieveGoal( name="PublishedVideo", refinements=[upload_milestone_refinement], annotation="milestone-driven refinement pattern" ) # Soft Goals from pros/cons analyzed from alternative refinement soft_maximum_interaction = SoftGoal( name="MaximumInteraction", refinements=[Refinement(complete=False, children=[achieve_published_video])], annotation="H6: Identify soft goals by analysing the pros and cons of alternative refinements" ) output = generate_graph([soft_maximum_interaction], []) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) return output, link def browse_videos(host="https://mermaid.live"): """Models video browsing with unmonitorability pattern""" viewer = Agent("Viewer", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) platform = Agent("Platform", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) # Browsing operations scroll_home = Operation("Scroll Home Screen", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) click_arrow = Operation("Click Navigation Arrow", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) load_thumbnails = Operation("Load Thumbnails", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) buffer = Operation("Buffer Thumbnails", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) # Low level goals achieve_scrolled_home = AchieveGoal( "ScrolledThroughContent if ScrolledHomeScreen", [PerformanceLink(viewer, scroll_home)] ) achieve_clicked_arrow = AchieveGoal( "NavigatedThroughContent if ClickedNavigationArrow", [PerformanceLink(viewer, click_arrow)] ) either_target = Goal( "If NavigatedThroughContent or ScrolledThroughContent then BrowsedContent", [PerformanceLink(viewer, scroll_home)] ) disjoint_cases= Goal( "ScrolledHomeScreen or ClickedNavigationArrow not (ScrolledHomeScreen and ClickedNavigationArrow)", [PerformanceLink(viewer, scroll_home)] ) maintain_unmonitorability = MaintainGoal( "ThumbnailNotDisplayedWhileMeasuredLoading", [PerformanceLink(platform, load_thumbnails)], annotation="unmonitorability refinement pattern" ) right_unmonitorability= Goal( "MeasuredLoading iff Buffering", [PerformanceLink(platform, buffer)], annotation="unmonitorability refinement pattern" ) maintain_thumbnail_loading = MaintainGoal( "ThumbnailNotDisplayedWhileLoading", refinements= [Refinement(complete=True, children=[right_unmonitorability, maintain_unmonitorability])], annotation="unmonitorability refinement pattern" ) # Mid level goals with unmonitorability pattern achieve_browsed_content = SoftGoal( name="BrowsedContent", refinements=[Refinement( complete=True, children=[achieve_scrolled_home, achieve_clicked_arrow, either_target, disjoint_cases, maintain_thumbnail_loading] )], annotation="decomposition-by-case refinement pattern" ) output = generate_graph([achieve_browsed_content], []) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) [PerformanceLink(streamer, setup_stream)], annotation="H7: Identify agent wishes" ) achieve_verified_connection = AchieveGoal( "VerifiedConnection if MaintainStreaming", [PerformanceLink(platform, verify_connection)] ) # Stream maintenance maintain_stream = Operation("Maintain Stream", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) maintain_streaming = MaintainGoal( "MaintainStreaming unless StreamedContent", [PerformanceLink(platform, maintain_stream)] ) # High level goal achieve_streamed_content = AchieveGoal( name="StreamedContent If maintainStreaming", refinements=[Refinement( complete=False, children=[achieve_setup_stream, achieve_verified_connection, maintain_streaming] )], annotation="guard introduction refinement pattern" ) output = generate_graph([achieve_streamed_content], []) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) return output, link def adjust_playback(host="https://mermaid.live"): """Models video playback adjustment with conflicting goals""" viewer = Agent("Viewer", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) platform = Agent("Platform", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) # Playback control operations adjust_volume = Operation("Adjust Volume", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) toggle_fullscreen = Operation("Toggle Fullscreen", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) # Low level goals using the operations maintain_adjusted_volume = MaintainGoal( "AdjustedVolume unless videoExited", performs=[PerformanceLink(viewer, adjust_volume)] ) maintain_toggled_fullscreen = MaintainGoal( "ToggledFullscreen unless videoExited", performs=[PerformanceLink(viewer, toggle_fullscreen)] ) # Quality control operations adjust_quality = Operation("Adjust Quality Settings", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) manage_bandwidth = Operation("Manage Bandwidth Usage", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) # Conflicting goals with their operations achieve_optimal_quality = SoftGoal( "AchieveOptimalQuality", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, adjust_quality)], annotation="H7: Identify agent wishes" ) maintain_minimal_bandwidth = MaintainGoal( "MinimalBandwidthMaintained unless videoExited", performs=[PerformanceLink(platform, manage_bandwidth)], annotation="H3: Instantiate Goal Categories" ) conflict_quality_bandwidth = ConflictLink( achieve_optimal_quality, maintain_minimal_bandwidth ) # Mid level goals combining user controls and quality management achieve_adjusted_playback = MaintainGoal( name="AdjustedPlayback if AdjustedVolume and ToggledFullscreen and minimalBandwidthMaintained unless videoExited", refinements=[ Refinement( complete=True, children=[ maintain_adjusted_volume, maintain_toggled_fullscreen, achieve_optimal_quality, maintain_minimal_bandwidth ] ) ], annotation="divide-and-conquer refinement pattern" ) output = generate_graph([achieve_adjusted_playback], [conflict_quality_bandwidth]) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) return output, link def search_video(host="https://mermaid.live"): """Models video search with OR-refinement pattern""" viewer = Agent("Viewer", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) platform = Agent("Platform", AgentType.SOFTWARE_AGENT) uploader = Agent("Uploader", AgentType.ENVIRONMENT_AGENT) # Search operations enter_keywords = Operation("Enter Keywords", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) process_search = Operation("Process Search", OperationCategory.SOFTWARE_TO_BE_OPERATION) upload_content = Operation("Upload Content", OperationCategory.ENVIRONMENT_OPERATION) # Low level goals maintain_controllable = MaintainGoal( "KeywordsEnteredWhileResultsToProcess", [PerformanceLink(viewer, enter_keywords)] ) maintain_controllable_2 = MaintainGoal( "UploadRelevantContentWhileResultsToProcess", [PerformanceLink(uploader, upload_content)] ) processing_search = SoftGoal( "ProcessingSearch or UploadingRelevantContent iff contentFound", performs = [PerformanceLink(platform, process_search)] ) # OR-refinement for search methods achieve_found_content = MaintainGoal( name="FoundContentWhileResultsToProcess", refinements=[ Refinement(complete=True, children=[maintain_controllable, processing_search, maintain_controllable_2]) ], annotation="H5: Split Responsibilities AND Uncontrollability Refinement Pattern" ) output = generate_graph([achieve_found_content], []) link = generate_pako_link(output, mode="edit", host=host) return output, link def real_time_accuracy = AchieveGoal(name="Real-Time Data Accuracy", leaf=True, performs=[PerformanceLink(agent=system, operation=real_time_accuracy_op)]) clear_visual_design = AchieveGoal(name="Clear
